ratings.comment: Awesome professor. Funny, clear, engaging lectures. If you have a chance to take a class with him, do so.

I would believe that Sam would be the ceiling of the math prof I had and I will have. He writes his own notes for 322, and his notes are amazing - physical interpretation with clear derivation, full of insights. His lecture is amazing as well. Vey nice guy. 10/10 recommmended

Look, at UW-Madison, you're not going to get a better math Professor. The math department is rough with lots of genius mathematicians that suck at lecturing and tough graders. Sam explains material really well (not perfect but well), and clearly CARES about his students. It's still a lot of work to do well, but he is a darn good math prof.

Prof Stechmann is the best math prof I've ever had. He always welcomes questions during lectures and is willing to re-explain the logic behind his steps in solving problems. His structure for the course is mostly based on examples rather than proofs, which are rarely on Exams. A notecard is allowed on exams, and practice exams are published.

Prof Stechmann was an enthusiastic and humorous lecturer, however he often skimmed through many topics in class and did not emphasize them properly, resulting in having to teach myself a lot of these topics before the exams. You are allowed a small notecard in your exams. There is weekly homework due in person and the exams are reasonably hard.
Above average professor who makes the math interesting and is helpful in office hours. Fair homework and exams, except there was some coding on most homeworks.

Sam is better than the average math prof here (as you mightve noticed already, they are usually bad). However: he often writes things on the board without explaining them. He sort of assumes you know exactly what hes talking about;things get confusing. Frequently makes mistakes that students have to correct. Weekly HW is OK, not lengthy.

He is good at lecturing however, when I go to office hours he has troubles doing homework problems. He would take a very long time trying to do them and sometimes would not even dot he problem right. He is not specific on grading especially with final grades as he takes down the website so that you can not see where your grade is at or the average.
Very good lecturer. He works  hard to ensure that all concepts are explained clearly and connected to other aspects of the course. He is, however, a very difficult grader.

His lectures are pretty engaging and he does a good job of explaining concepts. He also sprinkles in his unique sense of humor, which is great. He is extremely helpful in office hours and does an amazing job of guiding you towards the answer and making sure you completely understand the problem.
He is really good at helping you find answer on you own. By the way, he is quite humorous.

Professor Stechman was a great professor. I took him for 222 and did great in his class. He provided very clear lectures, and with the help of the homework that keeps you on track, the class is very maintainable. Tests were very fair.
Great professor, willing to help, tests are not that bad if you know the material and understand the textbook, sometimes funny which is a plus, really nice guy, makes sure class understands material

Stechmann is a decent professor. His notes could be more comprehensive but what he does explain he does a decent job of. Midterms and final were reasonable(final was way easier than the previous year). He tries to make sure everyone understands and is great during office hours. He also speaks perfect english which is a huge plus at Madison!

Sam is a great professor. He makes sure everyone understands the concepts before moving forward with the next one because the material in Math 222 is hard. He gives a ton of homework but it really helps you prepare for the exam. He's a very approachable, funny guy. I recommend him for Math 222!

Lets face it. Calc 222 is going to be hard no matter who you have. If you want a teacher that teaches the material and is easy to understand, get stechmann. Of the calc two professors ive heard the best things about him. hes a safe bet

He's never taught a large lecture like 222 before, but actually did a decent job. Lectures consisted of explanation of material followed by examples with some proofs for some subjects. He was good at answering questions; you can tell the guy's a genius (and a nerd). Exams weren't terribly difficult besides the final, which was unreasonably tough.
Both midterms were very reasonable, final was absurdly impossible. Homework and Quiz points help to boost grade at the end. You don't have to do amazing in the class to get a decent grade.
Easy to catch up with his pacce in class. Homework and exams are of moderate difficulties.
